title: Edit Once, Update Everywhere: A Simple Framework for Cross-Lingual Knowledge Synchronization in LLMs
author: Yuchen Wu (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Liang Ding (The University of Sydney), Li Shen (Sun Yatsen University), Dacheng Tao (Nanyang Technological University)
relevance_why: The proposed framework for cross-lingual knowledge synchronization could be applied to enhance language models utilized in audio and speech processing, allowing for multilingual support in audio generation tasks.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of updating large language models with new knowledge efficiently across multiple languages without necessitating full retraining.
contribution: This paper introduces the Cross-Lingual Knowledge Democracy Edit (X-KDE) framework to solve cross-lingual knowledge synchronization, achieving significant improvements in performance across multilingual tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically focused on monolingual knowledge editing, limiting their effectiveness in multilingual contexts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances cross-lingual knowledge edits by employing a two-stage process that includes specification tuning and preference optimization for maintaining consistency across languages.

key_innovation: The dual-stage approach allows for effective knowledge transfer from a dominant language to others, ensuring the LLM retains accuracy in both source and target languages.
real_world_impact: This research could significantly improve multilingual applications, potentially impacting language-based AI systems in fields like translation services and multicultural virtual assistants.
limitations: The authors acknowledge limitations related to the computational constraints of validation on models up to 7B parameters, with larger models remaining unexplored.

new_terms.Cross-Lingual Knowledge Democracy Edit (: This term refers to the proposed framework aimed at synchronizing knowledge across different languages in large language models efficiently.
